Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the statement that "Banks will be closed on all Saturdays." This is not true as per the expert's verdict, which states that banks are closed only on the second and fourth Saturdays of each month.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a viral message on social media, without any official confirmation or reliable source.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all banks will be closed on Saturdays based on a message circulating on social media, without verifying the authenticity or considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert's verdict provides an alternative explanation by stating that banks are closed only on the second and fourth Saturdays of each month, as per RBI guidelines.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that banks are not closed on all Saturdays, as clarified by the expert's verdict and tweets from prominent banks.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not considering the actual bank holiday schedule and relying on misinformation circulating on social media.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the claim.
